content: What exactly happens when you try to send it?
creator: kvon

content:
Please start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Does problem change?
creator: wsmwk

content: If it's possible to start over, - be sure thunderbird is NOT running on either PC - copy the c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder to external media - on new PC, copy the thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming - that will overlay the existing thunderbird folder - start thunderbird on new pc and everything should be there - now, you mention an IMAP account showing as POP. That does not work and may be the source of your problems. if you changed accounts, I recommend removing the bigpond account and creating the telstra account new. You may need to share more information here to resolve this.
creator: davidsk

content: Did it stop working? Or is it that you cannot find it? Please share more information.
creator: davidsk

content:
"Automatically applied filters are applied only to the inbox, with the exception of Archive and after send filters, which apply only to the mails involved in the action to send or archive. Other folder types are not affected."

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters#w_what-folders-are-filtered
creator: wsmwk

content: So is there any other method to do this?
creator: zbigi12321

content: When moving the profile, everything is moved. So, it remains to the original users. Maybe if you explain your intent, we may be able to give a more focused response.
creator: davidsk
